intro: Torularia kandaharensis, commonly known as the Kandahar torula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale yellow to greenish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
